description.value:
Characters with the maritime background grew up in and around sailing and large bodies of water. Whether in the water or on the deck of boats, this character is very comfortable with the water.

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID]{Languages}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID.JournalEntryPage.t1Js6zSa30XvbceF#common]{Common} and two others

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: two of your choice: (Recommended: &reference[Athletics] and &reference[Survival])

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools and Vehicles}: two @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#vehicles]{Vehicle types} of your choice, as well as @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#water]{Water Vehicles}

Items: the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools} (but not @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#vehicles]{Vehicles}) you gained proficiency with above

Starting Gold: 25 gold, which can be spent at character creation to buy nonmagical equipment at base cost.

Feat: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-feats.Item.3zeEYylMf4xbHquR]{Strong Swimmer}. If you already have a swim speed, you can instead choose a different level 1 feat.

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-background.Item.jBS3nsNqEe3MMenE]{Sailor's Vigilance}

In the world of Elkan, the Isles of Takat are a cold, unforgiving place. While there is a thriving lumber industry, most youth grow up in the water, rolling logs down rivers or working on ships. The human and elven shipwright families are the most influential, and determine who is able to advance to a lucrative career. Nearby, there are strange creatures in the deeps, but the people of Takat maintain their willingness to brave the terrible tentacled horrors.

advancement.hint: two of your choice: (Recommended: Athletics and Survival)
Note: Potter's Tools represent Sculptor's Tools

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: If you already have a swim speed, you can instead choose a different level 1 feat.

advancement.title: One of Any Tool
advancement.hint:
You gain the items corresponding to the tool proficiencies you gained from this background.
                        
                        If you gained proficiency in a mount or vehicle from this background, you do not gain that mount or vehicle. In that case, skip this step.
